Marco Baroni writes:
> Second, this morning I also noticed an out-of-memory error, and the crawler 
> was in pause mode. I sort of expected this, given the warnings re broad 
> scope in the documentation, but I am wondering: is there any use in 
> resuming the job (I crawled about half as much the data I would like to 
> crawl), or will it get out of memory again soon anyway? Any other solution? 
> (e.g., some setting I can change on the fly?)

In my experience the crawl is pretty much dead at that point. I have
yet to succeed in doing anything beyond shutting it down. I'm
re-running a crawl that ran out of memory spectacularly in 1.4 (this
with a 1G Java heap, SURT prefix scope) on a 1.5 snapshot and it has
been able to get a bit further.

There was a discussion of this a while ago: perhaps the archives will
have some of the IAs tips on this.

    -tree
